page.title: 13COASTAL FOOTPATH
page.content: {Pembrokeshire Coast Path}Long Distance route uses Venn Farm packed earth access lane, skirts the farm buildings and, undefined, crosses pasture field to the footbridge over a stream, and joins the outside peri- meter track of Gulf Refinery's fence. The path uses a steel bridge above the pipelines to the jetty. It then drops to Haven level at Wear Point White Lady Mark. Then, flanked with gorse bushes, passes a{picnic table site opposite the Power Station. The route continues through 2{kissing {gates}to reach the Ferry Inn at Hazelbeach; following the metalled minor country road the route passes the small waterside houses of the village, past the Norman style stone tower of the church, to join the Neyland promenade road at Mastlebridge by Mr Tom Goodall
